title: Shaco nerfs are too harsh
body:
I main Shaco, and don't think he is currently that strong.

I do not understand the philosophy behind nor the implementation of the PBE changes to Shaco. Here is what Riot said about the Shaco mini rework:

> Shaco could use a lot of love, enough that we can’t solve all of his problems as part of a class update. However, that’s no reason to ignore The Demon Jester. Shaco has always been known for his niche combat tricks, but we want to make those feel more relevant in teamfights and skirmishes. With that being said, his early game ganks need to be toned down. Shaco players should feel good about tricking their opponents, rather than merely appearing out of nowhere at level 3 and ruining their lane.

TL;DR - The mission is to tone down Shaco's early ganks and improve his teamfighting/skirmishing. 

In implementation they nerfed Shaco at every stage of the game.

Passive - Backstab

Old
1.  20% bonus damage when striking from behind

New
1.  120-145% minicrits when striking from behind (scaling by level)
2.  3s Cooldown (modified by cdr)
3.  200% minicrit on monsters
4.  Does not work with E

Analysis - Complete nerf at every stage of the game, for every build of shaco. 
AP - Nerfed because it doesnt apply to E
AD - Nerfed at level 1 because it essentially adds a 3s cd, nerfed at every other stage of the game because it replace's Q's crit scaling with a smaller crit %.
Hybrid - Nerf because Hybrid relies on E and the new Q scaling for damage, but E will not benefit from 20% backstab damage and had its ratio's cut.


Q - Deceive

Old
1.  Shaco Becomes stealthed for 3.5s, first attack during or soon after stealth deals a 140/160/180/200/220% dmg crit.

New
1.  Shaco Becomes Invisible for 1.5/2.25/3/3.75/4.5
2.  Cooldown increased to 14 seconds from 11 seconds
3.  Mana cost changed to 60 from 90/80/70/60/50
4.  20/35/50/65/80 (+100% total AD)(+50% AP)
5.  Attacking during or shortly after invisibility will reduce Deceive's CD by 2.5 seconds

Analysis - Complete nerf at every stage of the game for AD Shaco, slight buff for AP Shaco, and hybrid Shaco is garbage.
1. The Invisibility time now will not be equivalent with Live Shaco until 4 points which is level 7 at earliest.
2. This Invisibility change nerfs Shaco's early game as intended by the philosophy.
3. The CD was increased by 3 seconds, but can be reduced by 2.5s (so its only a .5s nerf) IF shaco lands an attack. This is a nerf to all shaco play styles as it just generally means less survivability from Q (its main purpose).
4. Shaco always had mana problems, so the mana cost reduction is nice.

AD - Nerfed pure and simple. This change adds roughly 15 dmg per point to an ALL IN attack which leaves Shaco with no means of escape, but removes its crit scaling. This is 100% a nerf at every stage of the game, and gets worse in the late game. Remember that the 100% AD it mentions is not 100% more Attack Damage added to your next attack, it's literally just saying it's going to do _your current AD_ PLUS 20 (at lvl1).

AP - I'm going to say this is a nerf at every stage. Early, AP Shaco relies on stealth to survive which got nerfed. Late, an AP Shaco will have enough AP to make a .5 scaling outscale the basedmg crit/backstab increase of old shaco's Q and Passive. (220% dmg on 117.08 base damage was 258 dmg +20% lost from old passive =308 total , this means that 117 base dmg + 145% new backstab crit = 170 dmg, which means that AP shaco has to have at least 276 AP before it does more damage than a completely itemless level 18 shaco on live). **Unfortunately an AP Shaco now has the choice between two poorly scaling abilities early game, neither of which has good base damage (Q and E). **

Hybrid - Maybe a buff, but there are really only like two hybrid items and I don't think Riot really intends to build this playstyle beyond Jax.

W - Jack in the box

Old
1.  60s Stealthed duration
2.  0.5/0.75/1/1.25/1.5 fear when popped
3.  Fires for 5s when popped

New
1.  +1s **STEALTHED** duration per 20AP
2.  Health scales with Shaco's level
3. Can not be stacked
4.  Can be placed from stealth but gives away Shaco's position

Analysis - Nerf for jungle shaco, buff for team fights

Jungle - No stacking means worse jungle starts, death bushes, and no double boxes to stop dashes. Also was a way to make sure a "hive" of boxes got some shots off before dying, hopefully health scaling will help. Unfortunately, health scaling means they start out weaker, and objectives like dragon can not be tanked by boxes until much later. Dropping boxes in stealth is a gimmick because it gives away Shaco's position anyway. Everyone will react as if you had just become visible anyway. Duration increase is nearly meaningless?

Team fights - Health scaling helps, the rest doesn't matter. Removal of stacking is a slight nerf.

E - Two Shiv Poison

Old
1.  Slows movement by 10/15/20/25/30%
2.  Slows monster attack by 20/22.5/25/27.5/30%
3.  50-210 (+100% AP) (+100% Bonus AD)

New
1.  5/35/65/95/125 (+90% AP) (+85% total AD) + [3-8% of target's missing health]
2.  Slows movement by 20/22.5/25/27.5/30%


Analysis - Nerf at every stage of the game for every build of Shaco. Removal from backstab passive is a straight 20% situational damage nerf, regardless of build. Moving on from that, let's consider the new damage / scaling. Removal of monster attack speed slow will likely be balanced by health scaling in the later game, but clears aren't a problem then any way, and box survivability has gone down early (when it is needed most)

at rank 1, a target would have to be missing 1500 HP to match the same damage as the old one.
at rank 5, a target would have to be missing 1062.5 HP to match the same damage as the old one, BUT WAIT! Don't forget about the 15% AD nerf, and 10% AP nerf to scaling. Couple this with the fact that Q is "Meant" to be leveled up first, and that means this will be getting maxed around the late game. This means that for the losses in AP/AD scaling, your target will likely _**still have to be missing around 1500 HP**_ to make up for the last damage. If anyone argues that Shaco is meant to be played hybrid now, realize that this is a bigger nerf to Hybrid Shaco than any of his other changes can make up for.

R - Hallucinate

Got a Meme. A useless, useless meme. AI changes might help. ?



So in conclusion:

Passive - Massive Nerf
Q - Nerf
W - Nerf
E - Huge Nerf
R - Memed

I think these are all just numbers tweaks, but it needs to be fixed before the patch is released. This is too much, and Shaco will be too weak if this goes live.

replies.body:
I have absolutely no idea what the intent of these changes is. I understand that Shaco's early game is quite strong and cheesy for enemy players, but right now I still deem him one of the most healthy assassins regarding his scaling. Shaco really needs to get a few kills to get rolling and delete his targets, while other assassins can do that without even being fed. Nerfing every single scaling he has AND removing his strong early game just leaves me clueless what to do with him. His Q is insanely weak now, his E can't be skilled first and lost tons of power and his passive seems just like they made it a weaker version of his old Q meaning that Q + passive now does around the same amount of dmg as his old Q if you attack the enemy from the front...

I'm sad...if they leave him as it is I'll be forced to completely stop playing him, because this doesn't seem like it'll be fun to play.
I'm going to at least try and find a way to make AD Shaco work. If nothing else, he'll keep on being the best split pusher in the game after he gets {{item:3087}} + {{item:3074}}.
Split pushing didn't get nerfed too bad, but remember that statik's effect critting is increased by shaco's old Q, so in a way even that got nerfed.

Thankfully he doesn't need his Q crit to clear effectively. Now we can even boost SS without having to use Q, so he will clear even faster.

Fuck. I can see him getting nerfed after reaching live.

>Patch 6.25

>Shaco's rework has given him way too much power with split pushing, so we're reducing his stealth duration to 1.5/1.6/1.7/1.8/1.9 seconds and changing his passive to bonus damage instead of crits.
Clear jungle faster, yes. Clear minion wave faster, no.
Past early game he has no need for backstabs or Q crit to clear waves fast. It shouldn't make that big of a difference. It's probably the one thing that will stay the same.

You're right about his current state, the changes now seemed to be made by someone with no in-game knowledge. His passive having a cooldown would only make sense if they buffed his Q damage, but they nerfed it instead on every feature.

Also for his E, if they were gonna give him single digit base values because they want to give him "execution damage" with that also only being single digits then they need to fire whoever's been working on these champion tweaks, cause it's terrible. % Missing HP damage falls third in the tier of enemy hp scaling as damage with %Max as first and %Current as second. The lower you go down that tier the more % you can tack on and/or add base damage and still be healthy (look at Eve's R for reference, she can't kill any 1hp targets because of no base damage and it dealing only %current damage which is only tier 2 on the list, so imagine this skill).

Following this, the way they nerfed his E base damage and scaling you'd think it would do true damage or %Max HP damage now, but it doesn't, it's backwards. Watch some shaco mains on youtube trying out the changes, they are horrible, he's gutted on every level. The only current change to the pbe changes that would literally make him somewhat viable without reverting the changes is if his new passive was something along the lines of "all damage you do is true damage" because he effectively lost over 50% damage in everything in his kit.

A fun thing they could have done was make his E an ability first of its kind to be able to do damage to both tanks AND carries and have it do all three types of %enemy damage and split it in two parts for counter-play like this, if his shiv hits a champion it deals:

3/6/9/12/15% Maximum HP + 6/12/18/24/30% Current HP as magic damage

And if Shaco autos that target in the next few seconds he retrieves the shiv and deals  9/18/27/36/45% Missing HP damage as magic damage, with this portion of the damage only scaling off the missing HP he chunked with the damage dealt with the initial hit.

ive been experimenting on pbe a bit. we need to bring additional base values and scalings into his build to make him viable whatsoever as an assasin. also, we need CDR. a ton. max cdr. you cant kill anyone who isnt a "gimme" early - mid game without it

I've tried the new shaco, and it's kind of stupid that building crit doesn't really work on him now in spite of him critting naturally. How counter-intuitive is it that his passive actually REDUCES his damage from behind as opposed to striking from the front if you can successfully crit? When riot said they'd put an AP ratio on his Q, I didn't think that meant they would sacrifice his typical AD build to do it. 

I absolutely love the design of the new kit, %HP is nice, Meme ult's fun and can make for a tricky escape (but fear duration should be longer), stealth duration and long CD sucks but 4.5 max rank is nice. 

He seriously needs some love in terms of actual numbers and not just cool ideas. Why do the other assassins get to have SO MUCH damage when Shaco just gets put into an awkward place with his build? You can't build crit, but flat AD got nerfed, but AP doesn't proc backstab anymore, etc.

At the very least I think Q needs it's damage pumped up a LOT higher. If shaco is meant to have "niche combat tricks", reward us for critting in the back with the Q, don't punish us by making us think "Ah man I've got IE and SS, I should've crit from the front instead! How stupid of me for trying to use my kit!" Alternatively, you could do something like graves where building crit would boost said backstab damage.

No, it's not. its 85% bonus AD, and its a nerf.
The info on the PBE says that it now scales with total AD, which means that the AD portion of its damage has been generally buffed.

Except that the loss of the base damage and bonus ad ratio do not actually make up for the lost damage.

On base damage alone the maxed E will do like 15 more damage _at level 18_. At 200 AD he's at parity with the current E, with any additional AD on top of that just being worse off overall.

And that's without factoring in the 20% backstab bonus.

Which is why I specified "the AD portion of its damage", it would take quite a bit of AD for 15% of bonus AD to outweigh all of Shaco's natural AD.

I fully admit the overall damage of Shaco's new E might be worse overall, I haven't really looked into it but it certainly seems the case just glancing at the numbers. I was simply trying to correct the notion that Shaco's E still scales with bonus as opposed to total AD.

it's almost like they're throwing a bunch of changes at the wall to see what sticks and what works before they change numbers too heavily... People have been having quite a bit of success on Shaco currently on the PBE so, while I think it may end up being a net early nerf (which I think was intended), overall it supports interesting playstyles.

To respond though, I think this change was definitely meant to support AP Shaco more both in the jungle and in general. An AP ratio on his Q helps Shaco utilize that spell with Lichbane a LOT better, the box health and increased duration means that a single AP Shaco box used to scout has more utility. The ult changes mean even if you don't necessarily hit people with the explosion, you still bring utility, CC, and disruption from AP Shaco (which is something he was greatly lacking before - a way to contribute to teamfights). I think that post-patch people are going to find AP more reliable than AD after the changes, but I think it will take time for the conclusion to be reached. In a way this was actually a good change for AP, because previously you relied almost entirely on someone walking into a nest of boxes early to do considerable damage, but now with HP scaling and duration scaling they can be used more like actual traps, giving you a reason to pick Shaco outside of "want to cheese at level 2".

basically, while Shaco's damage has been nerfed outright especially early, I think the AP changes will allow him to fill a more utility-focused role than before as AP while still contributing assassination (potentially more than previous AP Shaco due to the AP ratio on Q now).
